sentence.Network_en: But what if the government takes no heed?
sentence.Network_cn: 但如果政府不理会该怎么办呢？

sentence.Network_en: I cautioned him many times but he paid no heed.
sentence.Network_cn: 我多次劝告,他都置若罔闻.

sentence.Network_en: Chris would have been well advised to heed the old saying "Never bite the hand that feeds you."
sentence.Network_cn: 克里斯本应听从那句老话——“千万不要恩将仇报”。

No one heeds.(末尾是句号,说明此句一语双关,即在意思上关照上文和下文。如果...No one heeds无人理会。The light wind frets 微风吹拂And drift the scrum.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hēdan(originally intransitive), of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch hoeden and German hüten

entry.def: If you heed someone's advice or warning, you pay attention to it and do what they suggest.

example.ex: But few at the conference in London last week heeded his warning...
example.tran: 但在上周于伦敦召开的大会上，几乎没有人留意他的警告。

example.ex: Chris would have been well advised to heed the old saying 'Never bite the hand that feeds you.'
example.tran: 克里斯本应听从那句老话——“千万不要恩将仇报”。

entry.def: If you take heed of what someone says or if you pay heed to them, you pay attention to them and consider carefully what they say.

example.ex: He pays too much heed these days to my nephew Tom, and Tom is no great thinker...
example.tran: 他最近过分重视我侄子汤姆的话了，而汤姆根本不是什么伟大的思想家。

example.ex: But what if the government takes no heed?
example.tran: 但如果政府不理会该怎么办呢？

means.word_mean: 1. paying particular notice (as to children or helpless people);

sentences.sentence: "he spends without heed to the consequences"

means.word_mean: 1. pay close attention to; give heed to;

sentences.sentence: "Heed the advice of the old men"

means.word_mean: 听某人的劝告, 听从,留心,注意

sentences.en: I heeded my doctor’s advice and stopped smoking.
sentences.cn: 我听从医生的劝告, 把烟戒了。
